piXedfit_images¶

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.crop_ellipse_galregion(gal_region0, x_cent, y_cent, ell, pa, rmax)¶

A function for cropping a galaxy’s region within an ellipse aperture. The input should be in 2D array with values of either 1 (meaning that the pixel is belong to the galaxy’s region) or 0 (meaning that the pixel is not belong to the galaxy’s region)

Parameters

  • gal_region0 – Original galaxy’s region. Should be in 2D array as explained above.

  • x_cent – The central x coordinate of the galaxy.

  • y_cent – The central y coordinate of the galaxy.

  • ell – The ellipticity of the ellipse aperture used as reference in cropping.

  • pa – The position angle of the ellipse aperture used as reference in cropping.

  • rmax – The radius (along the semi-major axis) of tne ellipse aperture.

Returns gal_region

The cropped galaxy’s region.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.crop_ellipse_galregion_fits(input_fits=None, x_cent=None, y_cent=None, ell=None, pa=None, rmax=25.0, name_out_fits=None)¶

Function for cropping a galaxy’s region within a desired ellipse aperture and produce a new FITS file. The input should be the FITS file of reduced maps of multiband fluxes (output of the flux_map() method in the images_processing class).

Parameters

  • input_fits – Input FITS file containing the reduced maps of multiband fluxes. This FITS file must the output of the flux_map() method in the images_processing class.

  • x_cent – Central coordinate in x-axis of the galaxy. If None, central coordinate of the galaxy is assumed to be the same as the central coordinate of the image.

  • y_cent – Central coordinate in y-axis of the galaxy. If None, central coordinate of the galaxy is assumed to be the same as the central coordinate of the image.

  • ell – Ellipticity of the ellipse aperture used as reference in cropping,

  • pa – Position angle of the ellipse aperture used as reference in cropping.

  • rmax – Radius (along the semi-major axis) of tne ellipse aperture used as reference in cropping.

  • name_out_fits – (optional, default: None) Desired name for the output FITS file. This is optional parameter.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.crop_stars_galregion_fits(input_fits=None, output_fits=None, x_cent=[], y_cent=[], radius=[])¶

A function for cropping foreground stars within a galaxy’s region of interst. The input is a FITS file containing reduced multiband fluxes maps output of flux_map() function

Parameters

  • input_fits – The input FITS file

  • output_fits – Desired name for the output FITS file

  • and y_cent (x_cent) – Arrays containing cenral coordinates of the stars

  • radius – Arrays containing the estimated radii of the stars.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.draw_ellipse(x_cent, y_cent, a, e, pa)¶

Function for producing x- and y- coordinates of a line associated witn an ellipse aperture.

Parameters

  • x_cent – Central coordinate in x-axis of the ellipse.

  • y_cent – Central coordinate in y-axis of the ellipse.

  • a – Radius in pixel (along semi-major axis) of the ellipse.

  • e – Ellipticity.

  • pa – Position angle of the ellipse. This is measured in degree counterclockwise from the positive y-axis.

Returns ellipse_xy

2D array containing coordinates of pixels associated with the ellipse aperture. ellipse_xy[0] is the x coordinates, while ellipse_xy[1] is the y coordinates. To plot, do plt.plot(ellipse_xy[0],ellipse_xy[1]) with plt is matplotlib.pyplot.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.ellipse_fit(data=None, init_x0=None, init_y0=None, init_sma=10.0, init_ell=0.3, init_pa=45.0, rmax=30.0)¶

Function for performing an elliptical aperture fitting to a galaxy in a particular band. The aim is to get a suitable elliptical aperture around a certain radius (along the semi-major axis) of the galaxy. This function uses elliptical isophote analysis of the photutils package.

Parameters

  • data – Input of 2D array containing data of the image in a particular band.

  • init_x0 – (default: None) Initial estimate for the central coordinate in x-axis of the elliptical isophote. If None, the init_x0 is taken from the central coordinate of the image.

  • init_y0 – (default: None) Initial estimate for the central coordinate in y-axis of the elliptical isophote. If None, the init_y0 is taken from the central coordinate of the image.

  • init_sma –

    (default: 10.0) Initial radius in pixel (along the semi-major axis) for the initial guess in isophotal fitting. This is to be used for setting initial ellipse geometry in the elliptical isophote fitting with photutils.

  • init_ell – (default: 0.3) Initial ellipticity for the initial ellipse geometry.

  • init_pa – (default: 45.0) Initial position angle for the initial ellipse geometry.

  • rmax – (default: 30.0) Desired radius in pixel (along the semi-major axis) of the elliptical aperture.

Returns x0

Central coordinate in x-axis of the elliptical aperture.

Returns y0

Central coordinate in y-axis of the elliptical aperture.

Returns ell

Ellipticity of the elliptical aperture.

Returns pa

Position angle of the elliptical aperture.

class piXedfit.piXedfit_images.images_processing(filters=[], sci_img={}, var_img={}, img_unit={}, flag_psfmatch=0, flag_reproject=0, flag_crop=0, img_pixsizes={}, kernels=None, psf_fwhm=None, gal_ra=None, gal_dec=None, gal_z=None, stamp_size=[101, 101])¶

A Python class that can be used for processing of multiband imaging data. The processing basically includes PSF-matching to homogenize the spatial (angular) resolution of the multiband imaging data and spatial-resampling and reprojection to homogenize the pixel size and spatil reprojection of the mulltiband imaging data. A list of imaging data sets that can be handle using this class in the current version of piXedfit can be seen at List of imaging data.

Parameters

  • filters – List of photometric filters names in string format. The accepted naming for the filters can be seen using list_filters() function in the utils.filtering module. It is not mandatory to give the filters names in the wavelength order (from shortest to longest).

  • sci_img – Dictionary containing names of the science images.

  • var_img – Dictionary containing names of the variance images.

  • img_unit – Dictionary containing units of the input imaging data. The options aree: (1)0 if the image is in a flux unit, and (2)1 if the image is in surface brightness unit.

  • flag_psfmatch – Flag stating whether the multiband imaging data have been PSF-matched or not. The options are: (1) 0 means hasn’t been PSF-matched, and (2)1 means has been PSF-matched.

  • flag_reproject – Flag stating whether the multiband imaging data have been spatially-resampled and matched in the projection. The options are: (1)0 means not yet, and (2)1 means has been carried out.

  • flag_crop – Flag stating whether the multiband imaging data have been cropped around the target galaxy. The options are: (1)0 means not yet, and (2)1 means has been cropped. If flag_crop=0, cropping will be done according to the input stamp_size. If flag_crop=1, cropping will not be done.

  • img_pixsizes – Dictionary containing pixel sizes (in arcsecond) of the input imaging data.

  • kernels – (optional, default: None) Dictionary containing names of FITS files for the kernels to be used for the PSF matching process. If None, internal convolution kernels in piXedfit will be used. If external kerenels avaiable, the input should be in dictionary format like the input sci_img, but the number of element should be Nb-1, where Nb is the number of photometric bands.

  • gal_ra – Coordinate Right Ascension (RA) of the target galaxy.

  • gal_dec – Coordinate Declination (DEC) of the target galaxy.

  • gal_z – (default: None) Galaxy’s redshift. This is not used in any calculation during the image processing and calculating fluxes maps But only intended to be saved in the heder of the produced FITS file.

  • stamp_size – (default: [101,101]) Desired size for the reduced maps of multiband fluxes. This is a list data type with 2 elements. Accepted struture is: [dim_y,dim_x]. Only relevant if flag_crop=0.

flux_map(output_stamps=None, gal_region=None, Gal_EBV=0, mag_zp_2mass=[], flag_HST_all=0, PHOTFLAM_HST=[], flag_miniJPAS_all=0, unit_spire='Jy_per_beam', scale_unit=1e-17, sys_err_factor=0.0, name_out_fits=None)¶

Function for calculating maps of multiband fluxes

Parameters

  • output_stamps – Dictionary containing reduced multiband images produced by the reduced_stamps() function.

  • gal_region – 2D array containing the galaxy’s region of interest. The vlues should be 0 for masked region and 1 for the galaxy’s region of interest. It can be taken from the output of the galaxy_region() function. But, user can also defined its own.

  • Gal_EBV – (optional, default: 0) The E(B-V) dust attenuation due to the foreground Galactic dust. This is optional parameter.

  • mag_zp_2mass – (optional, default: []) Magnitude zero-points of 2MASS images. Sshoud be in 1D array with three elements: [magzp-j,magzp-h,magzp-k]. This is optional parameter. If not given (i.e. [] or empty), the values will be taken from the FITS header information.

  • flag_HST_all – (default: 0) Flag stating whether the all multiband images are from HST (value: 1) or not (value: 0). This flag can help assisting the calculation process especially if all the iamging data are from HST.

  • PHOTFLAM_HST – (optional, default: []) List of PHOTFLAM values (i.e., zero points for converting pixel value into flux in erg/s/cm^2/A) in HST image. This parameter is only relevent (i.e., considered) when the flag_HST_all=0. The number of elements in the list should equal to the number of HST imaging data. This parameter is not mandatory (optional). If this parameter is empty, the PHOTFLAM value will be taken directly from the header of the original FITS files.

  • unit_spire – (default: ‘Jy_per_beam’) Unit of SPIRE images, in case SPIRE image is included in the analysis. Options are: [‘Jy_per_beam’, ‘MJy_per_sr’, ‘Jy_per_pixel’]

  • scale_unit – (defult: 1.0e-17) Normalized unit for the fluxes in the output fits file. The unit is flux density in erg/s/cm^2/Ang.

  • sys_err_factor – (default: 0.0) An estimate for systematic error, in which the bulk is assumed to be a factor from the flux (in every band).

  • name_out_fits – Desired name for the output FITS file.

galaxy_region(name_segmentation_maps)¶

A function to get initial definition of the galaxy’s region of interest by merging together the segmentation maps.

Parameters

name_segmentation_maps – List of names of the segmentation maps.

Returns gal_region

Final merged-segmentation map.

reduced_stamps()¶

Function within the Class which runs the image processing that includes PSF matching, spatial resampling and reprojection, and cropping around the target galaxy.

Returns output_stamps

Dictionary containing name of postage stamps of reduced multiband images.

segmentation_sextractor(output_stamps=None, detect_thresh=1.5, detect_minarea=10, deblend_nthresh=32, deblend_mincont=0.005)¶

A function for deriving segmentation maps of a galaxy in multiple bands using the SExtractor through sewpy Python wrapper. To use this function, sewpy package should be installed.

Parameters

  • output_stamps – output_stamps output from the reduced_stamps().

  • detect_thresh – (default: 1.5) Detection threshold. This is the same as DETECT_THRESH parameter in SExtractor.

  • detect_minarea – (default: 10) Minimum number of pixels above threshold triggering detection. This is the same as DETECT_MINAREA parameter in SExtractor.

  • deblend_nthresh – (default: 32) Number of deblending sub-thresholds. This is the same as DEBLEND_NTHRESH parameter in SExtractor.

  • deblend_mincont – (default: 0.005) Minimum contrast parameter for deblending. This is the same as DEBLEND_MINCONT parameter in SExtractor.

Returns segm_map

Output segmentation maps.

Returns segm_map_name

Names of output FITS files containing the segmentation maps.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.kpc_per_pixel(z=0.01, arcsec_per_pix=1.5, cosmo='flat_LCDM', H0=70.0, Om0=0.3)¶

Function for calculating a physical scale (in kpc) corresponding to a pixel size of an imaging data.

Parameters

  • z – (default: 0.01) Redshift of the galaxy.

  • arsec_per_pix – (default: 1.5) Pixel size in arcsecond.

  • cosmo – (default: ‘flat_LCDM’) Choices for the cosmology. The options are: (1)’flat_LCDM’ or 0, (2)’WMAP5’ or 1, (3)’WMAP7’ or 2, (4)’WMAP9’ or 3, (5)’Planck13’ or 4, (6)’Planck15’ or 5, (7)’Planck18’ or 6. These are similar to the choices available in the Astropy Cosmology package.

  • H0 – (default: 70.0) The Hubble constant at z=0. Only relevant when cosmo=’flat_LCDM’ is chosen.

  • Om0 – (default: 0.3) The Omega matter at z=0.0. Only relevant when cosmo=’flat_LCDM’ is chosen.

Returns kpc_per_pix

corresponding physical scale in kpc unit of the given pixel size.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.skybg_sdss(fits_image)¶

A function for reconstructing background image of an SDSS image. The sample background image is stored in HDU2 of an SDSS image. As output, a fits file containing a background image is produced

Parameters

fits_image – An SDSS image in fits file

Returns output

A dictionary format that contains background image and the name

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.subtract_background(fits_image=None, hdu_idx=0, sigma=3.0, box_size=None, mask_region=[], mask_sextractor_sources=True, detect_thresh=3.0, detect_minarea=50)¶

Function for estimating 2D background and subtracting it from an image. This function also produce RMS image. Basically, the input image is gridded and the sigma clipping is done to each bin/grid.

Parameters

  • fits_image – Input image.

  • hdu_idx – (default: 0) The FITS file extension where the image is stored. Default is 0 (HDU0).

  • sigma – (default: 3.0) Sigma clipping threshold value.

  • box_size – (default: None) Gridding size.

  • mask_region – (optional, default: []) Region within the image that are going to be excluded. mask_region should be 2D array with the same size as the input image.

  • mask_sextractor_sources – (default: True) If True, source detection and segmentation will be performed with SExtractor and the regions associated with the detected sources will be excluded. This can reduce the contamination by astronomical sources.

  • detect_thresh – (default: 3.0) Detection threshold. This is the same as DETECT_THRESH parameter in SExtractor.

  • detect_minarea – (default: 50) Minimum number of pixels above threshold triggering detection. This is the same as DETECT_MINAREA parameter in SExtractor.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.var_img_2MASS(sci_img=None, skyrms_img=None, skyrms_img_data=[], skyrms_value=None, name_out_fits=None)¶

Function for deriving a variance image of 2MASS image. The estimation of uncertainty is based on information from http://wise2.ipac.caltech.edu/staff/jarrett/2mass/3chan/noise/#coadd

Parameters

  • sci_img – (default: None) FITS file containing the science image.

  • skyrms_img – (default: None) FITS file containing the RMS background image. If skyrms_img_data==[] or skyrms_value==None, this parameter should be provided.

  • skyrms_img_data – (default: [] or empty) 2D array containing the RMS background image, such as that output by subtract_background (the output[‘skybgrms’]).

  • skyrms_value – (default: None) Scalar value of median/mean of the RMS background image, in case 2D data is not available or only median/mean value over the whole field is sufficient.

  • name_out – (default: None) Desired name for the output FITS file. It is not mandatory parameter.

Returns name_out_fits

Name of output FITS file.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.var_img_GALEX(filter_name='galex_fuv', sci_img=None, skybg_img=None, name_out_fits=None)¶

Function for calculating and producing a variance image of an GALEX image

Parameters

  • filter_name – (default: ‘galex_fuv’) Filter name in string. Allowed options are: ‘galex_fuv’ and ‘galex_nuv’.

  • sci_img – (default: None) FITS file containing the science image.

  • skybg_img – (default: None) FITS file of the background image.

  • name_out – (default: None) Desired name for the output variance image.

Returns name_out_fits

Name of output FITS file.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.var_img_WISE(filter_name='wise_w1', sci_img=None, unc_img=None, skyrms_img=None, name_out_fits=None)¶

Function for deriving variance image of an WISE image. The uncertainty estimation is based on information from http://wise2.ipac.caltech.edu/docs/release/allsky/expsup/sec2_3f.html

Parameters

  • filter_name – (default: ‘wise_w1’) Filter name. Options are: ‘wise_w1’, ‘wise_w2’, ‘wise_w3’, and ‘wise_w4’

  • sci_img – FITS file containing the science image.

  • unc_img – FITS file containing the uncertainty image.

  • skyrms_img – FITS file containing the RMS background image.

  • name_out – Desired name for the output FITS file.

Returns name_out_fits

Name of output FITS file.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.var_img_from_unc_img(unc_image=None, header=None, name_out_fits=None)¶

Function for creating variance image from an input of uncertainty image.

Parameters

  • unc_img – Input FITS file containing the uncertainty image.

  • header – (optional, default: None) Input FITS file header. This is optional parameter.

Returns name_out_fits

Name of output FITS file.

piXedfit.piXedfit_images.var_img_from_weight_img(wht_image=None, header=None, name_out_fits=None)¶

Function for creating variance image from an input of weight image, which is defined as inverse variance.

Parameters

  • wht_image – Input FITS file containing weight image (i.e., inverse variance).

  • header – (optional, default: None) Input FITS file header. This is optional parameter. This is optional parameter.

Returns name_out_fits

Name of output FITS file.

A function for calculating variance image of an SDSS image

Parameters

  • fits_image – fits file containing an SDSS image.

  • band_char – A filter name in string.

Returns name_out_fits

Name of output FITS file.
